intro: Lysimnia bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other nettle species. The plant is characterized by its bi-colored leaves, with the upper surface being dark green and the underside a lighter, often reddish hue. Lysimnia bicolor typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are pollinated by insects.
